intro: Monelasmum viride, commonly known as the green monelasmum, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes many plants with milky sap and showy flowers. The plant is characterized by its slender, trailing stems and small, greenish-white flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a slightly hairy texture. Monelasmum viride is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its delicate appearance and ability to thrive in humid environments.
